newsitem.title: PERU: No damage at Southern Peru copper mines - police.
newsitem.headline: No damage at Southern Peru copper mines - police.

text.p: Peruvian police, conducting rescue operations after a powerful earthquake hit much of the south of Peru Tuesday, said on Wednesday the mines belonging to Southern Peru Ltd had not been affected.
"There are no problems in the area. We are concentrating our efforts in areas further north," said Milo Medano, police official at Arequipa, 640 miles (1,030 km) south of Lima.
Majority owned by ASARCO Inc and Peru's largest copper producer, Southern Peru produces copper from open-pit mines at Cuajone and Toquepala in the country's most southern department of Tacna.
Company officials were not immediately available for comment.
